The Big Deal about the "shed"

ouhajime.htm]
Fuijita Midori (wife of Fujita Tsutomu) told her daughter in =
law
Fujita Natsuko (wife of Fujita Minoru) that there was a magnificent
she=
d in [Hideo Takamine's] homestead, and it was full of treasures
such as swo=
rds or arts treasures. Although the shed was always
locked, only Goro was a=
llowed to enter this freely. Since Goro was
good at judging swords, he was =
often asked to judge or repair
swords.

all a "godown"....

n woman

ors Loomis and Trudeau later became the most
